columns.title: The columns in the table.  An array of objects

name.title: The column name.  Should be lower case with underscores, not spaces

type.title: The data type.  We use a limited set of data types for cross compatibility between Spark, R, Pandas etc.  See lookup here: https://github.com/moj-analytical-services/dataengineeringutils/blob/master/dataengineeringutils/data/data_type_conversion.csv

description.title: A description of what this table contains

name.title: The name of the table in the database

data_format.title: The format of the data in s3, and instruction on how to parse, see here https://github.com/moj-analytical-services/dataengineeringutils/blob/ae295caf93c75c80510abf0c74865939c94d3e70/dataengineeringutils/glue.py#L45

location.title: The path to the data in s3.  Usually, you should use path relative to the database root directory, unless the database contains tables spread across mutliple buckets or directories
